meanings.definition: The quality of being loud and resonant in sound.
meanings.sent1: The plangency of the thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The church bells rang with a deep plangency.
meanings.sent3: The plangency of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The plangency of the piano filled the concert hall with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The plangency of the trumpet made the audience sit up and take notice.

meanings.definition: A loud, mournful sound or tone.
meanings.sent1: The plangency of the funeral dirge brought tears to everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent2: The howling wind had a haunting plangency to it.
meanings.sent3: The plangency of the sad song made me feel strangely comforted.
meanings.sent4: The plangency of the violin seemed to express the depths of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The plangency of the bell tolls marked the passing of a great leader.
